channel.title: Comments on: Getting to “Hello world” with d3

item.title: By: D3 – Getting Started | abgoswam's tech blog
item.dc:creator: D3 – Getting Started | abgoswam's tech blog

item.title: By: Broto Bhattacharjee
item.dc:creator: Broto Bhattacharjee
item.description: @Anna it is probably not working because you have written src="../d3.v2.js" in the html file. However you might have downloaded a different version on d3. As in my case, I changed the line to src="../d3.js" and it worked thereafter.
item.content:encoded: @Anna it is probably not working because you have written src=”../d3.v2.js” in the html file. However you might have downloaded a different version on d3. As in my case, I changed the line to src=”../d3.js” and it worked thereafter.

item.title: By: Broto Bhattacharjee
item.dc:creator: Broto Bhattacharjee
item.description: @Anna it is probably not working because we have written in the html file. However you might have downloaded a different version on d3. As in my case, I changed the line to and it worked thereafter.
item.content:encoded: @Anna it is probably not working because we have written in the html file. However you might have downloaded a different version on d3. As in my case, I changed the line to and it worked thereafter.

item.description: Hi, what do you see in your console along with your blank screen?

item.title: By: Anna
item.dc:creator: Anna
item.description: It doesn't work... I know it has been some time since this post but why? I copied all as you wrote here and I get an empty screen. Otherwise, this is the only post so far in the whole internet that explains it the way it should be explained :)
